data.title: Cheryl Fernandez-Versini begs fans to 'live their life' in body shaming rant
data.meta_description: CHERYL FERNANDEZ-VERSINI has gone on yet another body shaming rant and has urged fans to just 'live their life' without worrying about what others think.
data.text:
Cheryl - who has constantly had to defend her slim frame - took to Instagram today to slam the media once again for judging people on the way they look.

The lengthy post began: "The other side of body shaming is skinny shaming. I think this happens just as much as shaming someone for being bigger."

She added: "How often do you hear someone say, 'give that girl a sandwich', or 'she needs a good feed'?

"Everyone says they want the 'perfect body' and have so many body goals, but when a girl is just that bit too skinny, in your eyes, she gets judged."

She also said that people nowadays have it drilled into them that "a certain size is too thin or too big" but she insisted that it's "ok to have a thigh gap".

Cheryl continued: "There is so, so, so, so much more to life than having the 'perfect body'. Every young person needs to understand that.

"Go travelling, learn about different cultures, be happy, fall in love and don't give a f**k about what people think.

"If your main goal in life is to be someone's 'body goals', you need to reconsider your attitude," she concluded.

Cheryl captioned the post: "I think it's about time people just leave others alone with their unnecessary and unwanted opinions and judgments. #liveyourlife"

The X Factor judge's latest rant comes after she said that body shaming should be "made illegal" in a recent interview.

“I can take whatever they [the press] throw at me after 13 years, what worries me is what it’s doing to the younger generation," the brunette beauty told ES Magazine.

"And some of the people writing this stuff are women. There is no sisterhood.

"The body shaming has to stop. It’s bulls**t. Something has to be done, changed, even if it’s done in law."
